snippet.title: Amiga Game - Burnout
snippet.description:
Amiga Game, Burnout by Mark Sheeky/Scorpius and released by Vulcan software 1996.

This game seems inspired by the Amiga PD game Knockout, but fails  at recreating it.  Lots of effort has gone into the gfx but not much else. As a commercial game, it fails, but as part of the vulcan collection, its worth a few goes.  This was released for around 15-20 Pounds.  Even in multiplayer though, I think id still choose Knockout.

I have completed the game in 10 mins, their is no real end sequence for it though.  AGA Amiga with 6mb ram and a hd is required. The  standalone game comes on 7 floppies ! 

The game seems to use a strange interlacing effect which WinUAE cant properly cope with and unfortunatly, Video quality has suffered as I try to get round it by not using line doubling and ramping framerate upto 60fps to try and counteract the flicker, but hopefully not unwatchable.

localized.description:
Amiga Game, Burnout by Mark Sheeky/Scorpius and released by Vulcan software 1996.

This game seems inspired by the Amiga PD game Knockout, but fails  at recreating it.  Lots of effort has gone into the gfx but not much else. As a commercial game, it fails, but as part of the vulcan collection, its worth a few goes.  This was released for around 15-20 Pounds.  Even in multiplayer though, I think id still choose Knockout.

I have completed the game in 10 mins, their is no real end sequence for it though.  AGA Amiga with 6mb ram and a hd is required. The  standalone game comes on 7 floppies ! 

The game seems to use a strange interlacing effect which WinUAE cant properly cope with and unfortunatly, Video quality has suffered as I try to get round it by not using line doubling and ramping framerate upto 60fps to try and counteract the flicker, but hopefully not unwatchable.
